								Besiege can be adequately described as the best and most limitless creativity toy around. It's, as you can probably already tell, a medieval-styled Crazy Machines with unlimited parts and well... medieval objectives.Why settle with a Trebuchet though if you can take to the skies in a Da-Vinci-like flying machine just to rain down fire on the enemy? Build a giant chariot with sawblades like in the trailer and watch your foes crumble and be gored to perfection, and if there is any true siege work on castles to be done, you can always deliver explosives right to the enemy's doorstep. How? Your way!Be wary of your amazing contraption taking fire though, those cannons and blades are going to be hard to use when your machine falls apart into ashes. Armour provides proof against hazards like oil pots, arrow fire and gouts of flames, but with the main part of your contraption made of reinforced plywood and medieval acceleration at it's finest/weakest, it's going to slow you down quite a bit.The Scenatios only restrict you in how big your vehicle/tower/plane/gun platform/glider/paradropper or hybrid can be and if you already completed a level, you can switch off this restriction at any point for unlimited siegecraft.I also must say that the game is very hardware-friendly and performs well for a freeform physics sandbox. Add to all that the spectacle on which you are probably most likely (I hope so for you) is served at an absolute bargain price and getting updated regularly, I only have one question to ask to you, dear reader:Why are you NOT playing this game right now?

Posted: December 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								Best value for money I think I've ever had from ANY game. Don't let those hours played fool you, I've had much more 'no-life' than that playing Besiege. And those hrs have been quality good fun gaming. ;)I'm not 100% sure, but I don't think any other game has made me, or does make me laugh harder than Besiege does. From igniting a spinning chicken to yak lobbing, it just seems to get funnier - ofc the caveat being you need a warped sense of humour and a little creative thinking to begin with, but aye, burning, drilling, and smashing a yak or just driving up and shooting a knight point blank in the face (with a missile) never seems to get old.It goes like this at 1st - spend 2hrs creating a masterpiece of destruction and mayhem, hit 'start simulation' and watch as said masterpiece self-destructs creating a huge mass of shrapnel that flies toward the intended target destroying it anyway and completing the level. Win. :)At the price, if this looks like your kind of game - then it propably is!Once you're comfortable with building stuff, go to the Besiege (SpiderlingGames) forums and DL 'Spaar's ModLoader' and TesseractCat's 'Editor+ Mod' (thanks you guys!) Edit: And the 'No Bounds' mod by ITR (awesome)And a last note - the progress isn't exactly speedy, but every update does add days more fun just not usually in an overt fashion - new blocks etc.EA or not - great value for money IMHO.

Posted: August 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Right now, Besiege is a game I would recommend. It is fun to spend hours building the perfect machine to pass levels or to build the most ridiculous thing in sandbox mode and sharing it with friends. The game is still early access though. It is still rough around some edges. Sandbox mode needs to be expanded so that you can place NPCs and structures where you want, there needs to be a camera option that doesn't follow the center of gravity of a creation (this is especially true when a creation blows up and the camera goes everywhere but where you want it to be. This makes it hard to take cool screenshots.), some of the in game settings won't apply when they are selected (I'm looking at you, tooltips), and some other really minor things that border of gripes. Despite the roughness, Besiege is worth every penny. I haven't had so much fun building death machines since Little Big Planet. In a way, this game feels like a medieval Little Big Planet with how it plays, which is a huge positive for me at least. I'll tell you the same thing I've told my friends, buy this game asap. I give the early access build of Besiege an 8/10. I can only see this score increasing in the future. tl;dr 8/10 buy this game

Posted: February 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								Review for Besiege:(TL;DR Pick this game up, it's totally worth the price.)Pros:1. The replayability is fantastic. After you finish a zone it gives you your stats. You have the ability to go back and change your machine and try a different approach.2. The zones themselves make you think and is a real challenge when you pick the game up. When I mean challenge, I don't mean difficulty. Again, it makes you think and it brings a nice sense of accomplishment everytime you finish a zone.3.  The game looks amazing. The shadows are well done, and the artwork/design of the game is beautiful. They did a fantastic job with the games appearance.4. While the items they give you to build with don't seem like much, the things you can create are infinite. Go look at what the ♥♥♥♥♥ community did/videos or pictures of what people build. Its crazy.5. The tools they give you help at greatly with your machine(s). You get to screw around with the properties, get to see how many blocks you currently have on your machine, and even the centre of mass which helps out immensely when trying to figure out how to get the weight to be stable.Cons:1. The amount of zones currently of this review is a little small, but then again its early access so I don't expect a complete game at all.2. Camera can be a little wonky, but the reset button is there for a reason and It doesn't ruin the enjoyment at all when I was playing.3. Learning how to make machines can get a little complicated at first but you get the hang of it after a little while.Other than that I really haven't seen anything wrong with the game. It's a very well built game. You may get stumped when trying to make complicated machines, but getting the reward of seeing it work is very satisfying.Final Verdict: 9.0/10 Very well built game. I recommend it for anyone who likes building games. Im very excited for the new zones and I will be playing this game for quite a while.

content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								ALPHA V0.04As always I was weary of an Early Acces title, but I had been looking for a game like Banjo Kazooie: Nuts and Bolts (hey, it was good in it's own right) and after reading the Early Acces thingy I was convinced for two reasons: they promised variety in levels aestethics and gameplay and they promised to always deliver a price proportionate to the content. So I bought this in it's earliest form, so I could eventually enjoy all of the content at the cheapest price. And to be honest, I was surprised by how robust this V0.04 alpha already is. The mechanics feel very near completion. My only problem is the lack of actual levels, but for 7 bucks this game is worth your money. And if they deliver upon their promises this game will eventually be worth way more than the 7 bucks you paid for it.If you're into building vehicles with physics and driving them around, this game's just the best there is. Even at this stage it's a blast, and that's at version 0.04. I can only imagine what this game will be like in a year from now.

content:
Posted: September 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								PLEASE READ WARNING AT THE END.Here are the basic details from my experiences in the game:-There are levels, albeit not many and it's been over a year since I have bought the game and I have noticed that they have introduced a new sandbox and the empty sandbox among various bugfixes, but no new levels, so dont go in expecting a fully fledged "campaign" so all in all you get a small campagin that may take you an hour or two, maybe even less to complete and you get 3 sandboxes to mess around in, the old sandbox, new sandbox and the barren expanse (empty sandbox).-You build siege machines, planes, airships, tanks, etc. If you have an idea for a killing machine, then you can most probably build it in Beseige. -Workshop content is a lot of fun to play with, especially hillclimbers and off road vehicles.-The building system can be quite a learning curve, especially when you try and build a flying machine.-Graphics are nice to look at, no complaints.-Game is quite cheap and you can squeeze quite a few hours out of it.Overall, for $9.99 I cant really complain. If you enjoy games that allow you to create various machines/vehicles, buy Besiege. It's a small game with not a lot of content as of yet but to be honest building is where you will spend most of your time.WARNING: Unless you have a ♥♥♥♥ing beast of a PC, I do not recommend you buy this game. I originally had this game on my laptop, it ran, but when creating medium sized machines the FPS would hit around 15-20. I built a gaming rig 2 months back, its pretty high end to be honest yet when I try to build a big machine or try to load a player created machine that has a decent amount of parts, the game goes down to like 10 FPS, coompletley unplayable and it takes away from the creation factor. I want to build and play big machines but I cannot because for some reason my high end PC cannot handle it, maybe the game is just terribly optimized, I can run all new games flawlessly bar this one. I know the game is in early access, but come on, its been over a year since its initial release.If not for the low FPS issue I would give this game a 9/10, I enjoy it, but this one issue ruins it for me so I cant help but give this game 6/10 (in its current state).
